t4.Board

Class Move

  • java.lang.Object
    • t4.Board.Move

  • public class Move
extends java.lang.Object
    A Move is a representation of a Player attempting to play in a specific location on the Board, identified by row and col.
    Author:
    Teddy

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Move(Board board, int row, int col, Player Player)
      Creates the Move the Player is attempting to make

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns the index of the column this Move is for
      Player getPlayer()
      Returns the Player playing this Move
      int getRow()
      Returns the index of the row this Move is for
      boolean inBoundaries()
      Checks whether the row and column indices are within the boundaries of the Board
      boolean isValid()
      Whether this is a valid Move for this Board
      boolean isWinning()
      Whether this Move is a winning Move, i.e.

            int row,
